WRITING.TEXT:
Haha this is great. I honestly hate that question so much. I mean I can understand if you've no idea of how stand up works why you would ask a comedian to 'say something funny' but seriously it's like pulling teeth when you have to explain it's just not like that. I once had a girl got really angry and call me a liar because I didn't want to tell her a joke.
I think other than 'say something funny', the next worst thing to hear is 'I bet you'll use this next time you're on stage!'.... No, no I will not.

WRITING.TITLE: Moonstone on the Amiga. Now THIS was my Skyrim!

WRITING.TEXT: I thought this was going to be a really deep and insightful piece about finding your comedic voice and essentially it's 'Talk about what you know'.
I think there are two very different motifs at play there.

I think you've completely missed the point. The problem isn't that Paddy Power are being disrespectful to Oscar Pistorious on the basis of being innocent until proven guilty it's that Paddy Power are being disrespectful of Reeva Steenkamp because regardless of the outcome of the trial, they are making money off the killing (being it intentional or not) of an innocent woman.
Don't get me wrong I reckon he's guilty as they come but regardless, how a company like Paddy Power can get monetary gain from someone's death is just disgusting.
Oh, OK you had me going for the first half, the second half kinda threw me...

WRITING.TITLE: Comedian tears into Paddy Power for taking bets on Oscar Pistorius trial. Hilarious but he really has a point.

Agreed

Jealously and genuine mental behavior. We had a pretty intense relationship, we used to either be arguing like crazy or having sex and partying. I suppose on reflection we were both mentally immature at the time but I've never met anyone who could get to me like she could. She was insanely jealous and I have a lot of female friends so she used to get shitty about me spending time with them or even taking to another girl. It got so bad I woke up once with her on top of me, hands round my throat threatening me that she'd dreamt I cheated!
Worst part is my mates loved her, she was the prefect 'mates-girlfriend'. She partied hard with them, was funny and a good laugh but behind closed doors treated me like shit. They couldn't believe me when is explain what she was like and just told me it was in my head or not all that bad.
I tried to break up with her and she said no. It's embarrassing as I'm a very confident guy and had no problem with women before so it's not like I should have felt trapped but I did. She emasculated me so a relationship that should have ended dragged on for another 6 months because I couldn't man up and just call it off and stick to my guns.
When it finally happened and she left she told me "you'll never find anyone who loves you like I do" and it fucked me up for a while. Made me paranoid when with women that they were jealous or controlling and I was distant with some lovely people because I was scared to get close to someone in case they tried to control me.
However after all that I'm now in the perfect relationship and I couldn't be happier. Seems I not only found someone who loves me more than she did but who I love more than I ever knew I could. Clich but in the long run it developed me further as a person and is part of why I'm so happy now.
